column4: I am trying to play a DVD and the sound is skipping.  how can it be fixed?  happens with all DVD's . they play fine in a dvd player
what are you using to play them?
run mplayer from a terminal (command line) see what is the problem with the audio; try different audio options and see if some of them works for you
how do I run it from the cmd line
to find what your dvd device is use "dmesg |grep -i dvd"
read this link to learn about mplayer usage, browse through chapters to learn how to change the audio options, etc. I'm pretty sure mplayer will make it work for you, it has never failed me :)
libdvdread: Using libdvdcss version 1.2.10 for DVD access
sorry forgot to paste it :p anyways, it's weird it prints that error, is your drive a dvd-rom one? does Ubuntu recognizes as one?
mplayer dvd://dev/cdrom0 <= won't play.. right click and play works but the sound is off
although the error you pasted early is very weird; I haven't seen it before
I am gonna get a job in destructive testing lol
[0x7f4424083ce8] libmpeg2 decoder error: DpbUnlinkPicture called on an invalid picture
